text: hello my name is Benjamin Kyle you don't
know who I am
and quite frankly neither do I on August
31st 2004 a man was found outside a
Burger King restaurant in Richmond Hill
Georgia a man was found completely naked
bein and covered in blood with no signs
of identification on him according to
the employee who found him he looked
like quote/unquote somebody tried to
kill him
the man who was initially thought to be
homeless was rushed to the hospital for
treatment and fortunately survived
unfortunately though when paramedics
asked for his identity he could not
remember his name more so he could not
remember anything about himself how he
ended up in the situation any relatives
or friends or anything before his
discovery he went under the pseudonym
Benjamin Kyle spelled with an A because
that seemed familiar to him for some
reason
Benjamin spent the next couple of years
trying to uncover his identity with the
help of government officials he took
several DNA tests researched the birth
certificates of those born around his
remember birth year did facial
recognition tests under what hypnosis
and attempt to uncover some memories
with a few results and even appeared on
talk shows like dr. Phil it's kind of
amazing and terrifying that despite all
the search efforts and publicity he's
had for over a decade no one knew who he
was
he's unidentifiable
the story of Benjamin Kyle is truly a
fascinating one and it's the case that
led me to create this video I really am
baffled that no one has come forward
claiming to know Benjamin and he
remained missing for over a decade
thankfully in 2015 a genealogist named
Cece Moore was finally able to track
down Benjamin's identity through an
Indiana high-school yearbook from 1967
uncovering his real name as William
Powell William still has no recollection
of his past to this day this case led me
down a rabbit hole of similar cases of
missing identities
some more terrifying than others
on December 1st 1948 a man was found
dead on Somerton Beach just south of
Adelaide in Australia he was propped up
on a seawall with little to nothing on
him
save for a half-smoked cigarette on his
lap oh and a strange note that read
tamam shud a persian phrase which means
ended or finished with no identification
on him this man became known as the
Somerton man or sometimes the unknown
man after the body was taken to the
Royal Adelaide Hospital doctors found
that all name tags and marker labels
have been clipped from his clothing
he had no wallet on him either there was
blood in his stomach
leading the doctors to believe he may
have been poisoned but nothing in the
food remaining in the stomach had any
indication of poison a strange
unidentified orange thread was found to
have been used the stitches clothing the
coroner Thomas Cleveland hypothesized
that there were two poisons I could have
been administered to the Somerton man I
could have dissolved by the time the
autopsy was performed digitalis and
stroke panthan blood and urine tests
found no traces of any poison though so
the ultimate cause of death was simply
heart failure whether it was caused by
poison and a self-administered way or
with murderous intent remains unknown
the case was a standstill until six
weeks later when an abandoned suitcase
was found at the Adelaide railway
station the same orange thread material
that was found on the Somerton man's
clothing was found in the suitcase it
was identified as the luminous barber
thread a rare thread that couldn't be
found Australia all the clothing found
in the suitcase was the exact same size
as the Somerton man's clothing a few
nametags were found with t keen rin on
them sadly this brought in no new leads
and the trail went cold again months
later a man walked into the ax tectus
office with a copy of the book at the
phrase
tamam shud came from which had been
ripped from his book he reported that in
December of the previous year when the
Somerset man was found he and his
brother-in-law drove to Somerton Beach
when they returned they found the copy
of the book in their car the detective
sergeant lino Leanne looked inside the
book and found two unlisted phone
numbers the first number was nothing but
dead air but the second led to a young
nurse living in Somerton known as
Justine with the real name never being
revealed to the public she claims to
have never known the summer to man but
almost fainted upon being shown a cast
of a space Justine was at first
reluctant to speak to police but
eventually revealed that she had given a
copy of the same book to a man named
Alfred Boxall the police pursued this
lead only to find that box though was
still alive and well with his copy of
the book still in his possession they
put the copy with the ripped phrase
under a black lights in order to find
anything they may have missed the book
revealed a strange code with five lines
of random letters the second of which
was crossed out and the other three were
separated by lines with an X over them
Naval Intelligence was unable to crack
the code so they published in newspapers
to see if anybody else could figure it
out
nobody could
On June 14th 1949 the police finally
laid the case to rest when the
investigation was published in 1958 the
report concluded with the coroner
stating I am unable to say who the
deceased was I am unable to say how he
died or what was the cause of death in
recent years the Somerton man case has
been reignited by those curious about it
many theories began popping up online
such as him killing himself after being
rejected by Justine she clearly has some
sort of connection to him after all
Justine also had a young son who could
have been the Somerton man's son as well
due to their facial similarities another
theory was that he was a spy who just
knew too much the poisons the doctor
theorized were used were not your common
run-of-the-mill poisons after all and
his appearance and coded messages only
added fuel to the fire nobody came
forward to claim his body either even
after it was broadcast all around the
world the mystery still remains unsolved
or perhaps someday the code will be
cracked and the identity of the
mysterious Somerton man will finally be
revealed on November 29th 1970 the burnt
body of a woman is found in is de lijn
translated to ice Valley in Bergen
Norway the labels on her clothes were
ripped out in any form of identification
had been stripped from her it's almost
as if somebody didn't want her to be
found they wanted her erased
Helena's also known as Death Valley to
the locals as it was the site of many
suicides in medieval times as well as
where many hikers fall to their deaths
however this woman didn't appear to be a
hiker so what was she doing there the
body was burnt to a crisp on the front
specifically her hair and face but oddly
enough her back was relatively unscathed
police uncovered a number of objects at
the crime scene such as jewelry a watch
some bottles and a broken umbrella she
wasn't wearing the watch or the jewelry
they were just kind of there which
police found suspicious the bottle
labels had been rubbed off
well with no identity the police refer
to her as B is Dell woman as the trail
begins to go cold a new clue reveals
itself at the Bergen railway stations
lost luggage departments two suitcases
were found one containing a pair of
glasses that had the woman's
fingerprints on them as well as various
articles of clothing money from several
different countries and a tube of
medical cream much like the clothes on
her body all the labels had been ripped
off here as well even the name on the
prescription for the medical cream was
removed however there was one
interesting piece of evidence a plastic
bag from a shoe store in Stavanger
Norway upon visiting the store the
owner's son says that he recalls selling
a pair of boots to a very well-dressed
nice-looking woman with dark hair he
says that she made an impression on him
because she took much longer than any
customer normally would to pick out
boots the boots found in her body
matched the boots from the store so it's
clear that these two women are one in
the same according to the son she spoke
English with an accent I had a very
strong scent of garlic the police who
used that description to trace her
footsteps to a nearby hotel where it was
confirmed that the woman stayed there
under the name
Fenella Lorch except that that wasn't
her real name it turns out she stayed on
many hotels in Norway using a different
name each time which meant that she also
had several fake passports after
interviewing several hotel employees it
became clear that the woman left a
strong impression on people
she also often requested a room changes
which is suspicious at this point many
people believed that she was a spy the
cold war was in full swing at the time
and she was an elegant wealthy woman
visiting seemingly unimportant places
a mysterious code was found in the
woman's suitcase as well but after
cracking it it only revealed the places
she had visited which was already known
a police autopsy report reveals strange
bruises telling that her death was
likely a very painful one a high amount
of sleeping pills were also found in her
stomach leading investigators to finally
call the death as a suicide many people
were not convinced however given
everything that happened and how cryptic
everything seemed to be regarding her
death it's clear that this was no
suicide regardless she was given a
Catholic funeral and was laid to rest in
2016 the search started up once again
though upon examining that tea from her
skull she had 14 gold crowns this was
unusual for someone her age and the
dental work was unlike anything seen in
Norway at the time additionally with
being a test being more advanced today
than they were in 1870 the investigation
was slightly reopened to allow for more
details after tests came back and
extended DNA profile was revealed
showing that she was likely of Israeli
descent given that it's only been two
years since the case is reopened
perhaps the identity of the is dull
woman will be revealed we'll just have
to wait and see
until now all the cases we've covered
have pertained to adults while an
unidentified Doe is still a terrifying
notion perhaps even more unsettling is a
child forever lost and death known as
the boy in the box as well as America's
unknown child the body of this young
child was found wrapped in a flannel
blanket inside a discarded baby's
bassinet cardboard box from JC Penney's
the body was first officially discovered
on February 25th 1957 by a college
student who came across the box that's
the first official discovery as it was
reported to the police however two days
prior the body was discovered by a man
who was checking on his illegal Muskrat
traps in the area being that his traps
were illegal he never reported the body
to the police so as to protect himself
the college student who reported the
body to the police also waited a day
before saying anything as he was in the
area stalking a young woman and was
afraid to tell the police his reason for
being there after being reported to the
police
posters of the boy were plastered
everywhere in Philadelphia in attempts
to identify him the boy had blue eyes
fair complexion truly cook brown hair
and deep harsh bruises due to the cold
weather
the boy was estimated to be in the box
for as little as two days to as much as
three weeks despite the amount of fliers
and word spread about the boy nobody
ever came forward to claim or even
identify him the JCPenney box couldn't
be traced to an owner and the boys
fingers and footprints all came up
negative when searched in the nationwide
database the police scraped together
what little evidence they had to try and
figure out anything they could get the
cause of death the identity or the
murderer
the crudely cut hair indicates that it
was cut after he had died or at least
shortly before he was severely
malnourished had a chronic eye alignment
and had dark brown residue in his
esophagus indicating he had vomited
shortly before death the cause of death
was revealed to be multiple blows to the
head confirming that this was without a
doubt a
with no evidence as to who the boy was
he was eventually buried in a potter's
field with a tombstone that's simply
read Heavenly Father blessed this
unknown boy a boy's body was exhumed in
1998 and mitochondrial DNA was extracted
from his tooth unfortunately it wasn't
enough to link him to any potential
relatives and the case remains unsolved
to this day a few theories exists about
the identity of this boy
the first was quickly laid to rest with
the initial college student who found
the body being considered a suspect
due to his creepy behavior of stalking
young woman in the nearby area however
he was cleared via a lie-detector test a
nearby foster home was also investigated
however all children were accounted for
and all the families were checked out
some still believed that the owner of
the foster home Arthur Nicoletti was
involved somehow since he refused to
take a lie-detector test the strongest
lead in theory came in 2002 when a woman
known as M claimed that her mother
bought the boy from his parents in 1954
and named him Jonathon he was frequently
abused and was kept in the basements he
was also handicapped and was unable to
speak
eventually m's mother killed him in a
fit of rage after he vomited in the
bathtub this was the most lucrative lead
the investigators had in the case so far
but it was debunked six months later
after was revealed that M had a history
of mental problems and none of her story
could be confirmed

two unidentified individuals known
collectively as the Sumpter County dos
this young couple was found really
murdered in the August of 1976 in Sumter
County South Carolina they were found
with multiple gunshot wounds including
one on their back their chest and the
finishing blow on their throats no
identification could be found their
bodies and their fingerprints and dental
records gave investigators no leads
whatsoever a male victim known as
Jacques Doe was believed to have been
somewhere between 18 and 30 and appears
to have had dental work that was
performed outside of the United States
the female victim known as Jane Doe was
believed to have been between the ages
of 18 and 25 she had unusually long
natural eyelashes and was clean shaven
and well-groomed much like her male
counterpart they both also wore no
underwear there were no leads until that
December when a truck driver named
George Henry was stopped in South
Carolina for driving under the influence
police found in his possession a stolen
gun that had its serial number scratched
off this gun was eventually determined
to be the murder weapon
but later interviews and polygraphs
revealed that Henry was not the murderer
he claims that his brother Jim Henry
gave him the gun as a gift a forehand
the gun was stolen by a group of thieves
leading investigators to believe that
one of them may have committed the
murder a few trinkets found on the male
victim included some notable clues such
as the initials JP F being engraved on
his pocket ring as well as the book of
matches that were purchased at a truck
shop chain with locations in Idaho
Nebraska and Arizona a man from one of

he may have performed car maintenance
for the couple but it has no way of
knowing for sure
